name: Jinming Duan 0001
content: Dr Jinming Duan - School of Computer Science - University of Birmingham Dr Jinming Duan BSc PhD School of Computer ScienceLecturer of Computer Science Contact details Emailj.duan@bham.ac.uk View my research portal AddressThe School of Computer ScienceUniversity of Birmingham Edgbaston Birmingham B15 2TT UK Dr Jinming Duan is a Lecturer in Artificial Intelligence in Medicine. His work focuses on cutting-edge machine learning methods for cardiovascular imaging. His PhD thesis focused on modern variational and partial differential equation (PDE)-based methods, with applications to image processing and analysis. He is a lead collaborator of the EPSRC SmartHeart Programme at University of Birmingham. His research works have appeared across multiple application publications, including proceedings such as MICCAI, and journals such as Nature Machine Intelligence, IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging, IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, etc. He regularly reviews more than 30 reputable journals. For more information, please see Dr Jinming's Computer Science profile. Before moving to University of Birmingham, he was a Research Associate jointly within Department of Computing and Institute of Clinical Sciences at Imperial College London. There, he has been working closely with Prof. Daniel Rueckert , and researching cutting-edge artificial intelligence methods for cardiovascular imaging. Prior to that, he studied his PhD in Computer Science at University of Nottingham. His PhD thesis focused on modern variational and partial differential equation (PDE)-based methods, with applications to image processing and analysis. He acquired both his undergraduate and master degrees in Computer Science. His research works have appeared across multiple application publications, including proceedings such as International Conference on Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention (MICCAI), and journals such as Nature Machine Intelligence, IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging, IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, Pattern Recognition, Physics in Medicine and Biology, Journal of Mathematical Imaging and Vision, Journal of Global Optimisation, etc. He regularly reviews more than 30 reputable journals. His research includes deep neural nets, variational methods, partial/ordinary differential equations, numerical optimisation, and finite difference/element methods, with applications to image processing, computer vision and medical imaging analysis.
